text: Anna E. Song is a South Korean-born American politician, best known for being California's first female South Korean-born elected official. ==Political career== Originally being elected to the Santa Clara County School Board http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2008/03/08/MN4BVG0DD.DTL in November 2000, Song served as Board president in 2004, and she won overwhelming re-election to a second four-year Board term that fall. Her reelection to the Board in 2008 was a more contested race — Song prevailed with 53.73% of the vote against Milpitas City Councilwoman Carmen Montano. Song also won re-election in 2012 against Berryessa School Board Member David Neighbors — earning 58% of the vote despite more than a quarter million dollars ($250,000) spent against her in the campaign. Anna Song was awarded the prestigious John F. Kennedy, Jr. Award from the California Democratic Party in 2002. On May 12, 2019, Song announced that she would a candidate for the California State Assembly in 2020. She ran to succeed incumbent Kansen Chu, who was not seeking reelection.https://sanjosespotlight.com/education- trustee-anna-song-to-run-for-california-assembly/ She was defeated in the March 3 primary.https://electionresults.sos.ca.gov/returns/state- assembly/district/25 Song, a resident of Santa Clara, California, is the mother of Nicholas and Timothy. Song holds a BA from the Franciscan University of Steubenville and has completed graduate courses at the Franciscan School of Theology in Berkeley, California. ==External links== * Biography on the Santa Clara County Office of Education web site * Santa Clara County Board of Education willing to foreclose on former superintendent * Mercury News editorial: Santa Clara County board should renegotiate mortgage with De La Torre ==References== Category:Living people Category:American women of Korean descent in politics Category:Franciscan University of Steubenville alumni Category:People from Santa Clara, California Category:South Korean emigrants to the United States Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Anna Song (politician)
